Financial Aid Application Guide

Understanding Financial Aid

Financial aid helps make college more affordable by providing grants, scholarships, loans, and work-study opportunities. Completing financial aid applications is a critical step for students aiming to study in the USA.

Steps to Apply for Financial Aid

  • Step 1: Research Financial Aid Options

    Identify schools offering need-based aid, merit scholarships, or international student grants.

  • Step 2: Complete the FAFSA

    The Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) is required by most colleges for financial aid. Visit studentaid.gov to get started.

  • Step 3: Submit the CSS Profile

    Many private colleges require the CSS Profile to evaluate your financial need. Apply through College Board.

  • Step 4: Provide Supporting Documents

    Prepare income statements, tax returns, and other documents required by colleges.

  • Step 5: Apply for Scholarships

    Search and apply for external scholarships from organizations, foundations, and private entities.

  • Step 6: Follow Up with Colleges

    Communicate with the financial aid office to ensure all materials are submitted and to ask any questions.

EFK Scholars' Financial Aid Support

We guide students through the entire financial aid process, including filling out the FAFSA, CSS Profile, and scholarship applications. Our team ensures that every student maximizes their opportunities for funding.
